sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: September 4 was registration day for the Aurora Evening School. Thirty persons have registered. There is enough room for many more students.
In the evening school the following subjects will be taught:
6). How to read and write correctly in Lithuanian.

The classes will be [conducted] two evenings a week, two hours per evening. For English, arithmetic, geography and history lessons, [the fee] will be
$7.00 per month, less than six cents an hour. For Lithuanian, the class will be once a week--the fee will be 50 cents a month; for draftsmanship, two evenings a week, $10.50 per month. The class in how to read and write in Lithuanian will be given once a week, one dollar for six months. We are inviting all those who are thinking of joining our school to come without delay. You can register every evening, between 6:30 and 7:30, at the Aurora reading room, 3149 S. Halsted Street. Sundays, from 10 A.M. to 7 P.M.
